content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown document `md` with many lines. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer as a NamedTuple with keys `question` and `answer`. For a section to be valid, it must start at the beginning of the line. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text. Provide example.

**Notes:** - In this exercise we consider a "section" to be everything between the Question and Answer markers. - The lines in markdown can contain many types of special characters, including HTML tags (e.g., `

`, `

`), code blocks (```) or inline code (`). Be careful with spaces and newlines! Use only `strip(str)`. Don't use `lstrip()` as it will remove the leading space in front of the section name. - It is OK to ignore any text that does not look like Question or Answer sections. - You can test your solution with a file, e.g., `md = read("your_markdown.md", String)`
